LocalSoftware.Name: gatk
LocalSoftware.Description: The Genome Analysis Toolkit or GATK is a software package developed at the Broad Institute to analyze high-throughput sequencing data. The toolkit offers a wide variety of tools, with a primary focus on variant discovery and genotyping as well as strong emphasis on data quality assurance. Its robust architecture, powerful processing engine and high-performance computing features make it capable of taking on projects of any size.

LocalSoftware.Name: bioperl
LocalSoftware.Description: BioPerl is a collection of Perl modules that facilitate the development of Perl scripts for bioinformatics applications

LocalSoftware.Name: qiime
LocalSoftware.Description: QIIME is an open source software package for comparison and analysis of microbial communities, primarily based on high-throughput amplicon sequencing data (such as SSU rRNA) generated on a variety of platforms, but also supporting analysis of other types of data (such as shotgun metagenomic data).

LocalSoftware.Name: qiime
LocalSoftware.Description: QIIME is an open source software package for comparison and analysis of microbial communities, primarily based on high-throughput amplicon sequencing data (such as SSU rRNA) generated on a variety of platforms, but also supporting analysis of other types of data (such as shotgun metagenomic data).

LocalSoftware.Description: PeakRanger is a multi-purporse software suite for analyzing next-generation sequencing (NGS) data.

LocalSoftware.Description: BreakDancer is a Perl/C++ package that provides genome-wide detection of structural variants from next generation paired-end sequencing reads.

LocalSoftware.Name: mapsplice
LocalSoftware.Description: MapSplice is a software for mapping RNA-seq data to reference genome for splice junction discovery that depends only on reference genome, and not on any further annotations.

LocalSoftware.Name: usearch
LocalSoftware.Description: USEARCH is a unique sequence analysis tool with thousands of users world-wide. USEARCH offers search and clustering algorithms that are often orders of magnitude faster than BLAST.

LocalSoftware.Name: phrap
LocalSoftware.Description: Phrap is a program for assembling shotgun DNA sequence data. Cross_match is a general purpose utility for comparing any two DNA sequence sets using a 'banded' version of swat. Swat is a program for searching one or more DNA or protein query sequences, or a query profile, against a sequence database, using an efficient implementation of the Smith-Waterman or Needleman-Wunsch algorithms with linear (affine) gap penalties.

LocalSoftware.Name: opencv
LocalSoftware.Description: If the library finds Intel's Integrated Performance Primitives on the system, it will use these proprietary optimized routines to accelerate itself.

LocalSoftware.Name: blast-legacy
LocalSoftware.Description: NCBI BLAST sequence alignment package. The program compares nucleotide or protein sequences to sequence databases and calculates the statistical significance of matches.

LocalSoftware.Name: repeatmasker
LocalSoftware.Description: RepeatMasker is a program that screens DNA sequences for interspersed repeats and low complexity DNA sequences.

LocalSoftware.Name: subread
LocalSoftware.Description: The Subread package is developed in The Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research, Melbourne, Australia. It consists of a suite of programs for processing next-gen sequencing data.

LocalSoftware.Name: varscan
LocalSoftware.Description: VarScan is a platform-independent mutation caller for targeted, exome, and whole-genome resequencing data generated on Illumina, SOLiD, Life/PGM, Roche/454, and similar instruments.

LocalSoftware.Name: samtools
LocalSoftware.Description: SAM Tools provide various utilities for manipulating alignments in the SAM format, including sorting, merging, indexing and generating alignments in a per-position format.

LocalSoftware.Name: samtools
LocalSoftware.Description: SAM Tools - a generic tool for the sam format alignments.

LocalSoftware.Name: samtools
LocalSoftware.Description: SAM Tools - a generic tool for the sam format alignments.

LocalSoftware.Name: mutect
LocalSoftware.Description: MuTect is a method developed at the Broad Institute for the reliable and accurate identification of somatic point mutations in next generation sequencing data of cancer genomes.

LocalSoftware.Name: biodata
LocalSoftware.Description: Static data resources for bioinformatics/computational biology.

LocalSoftware.Name: sff2fastq
LocalSoftware.Description: sff2fast extracts 454 Genome Sequencer reads from a SFF file and converts them into a FASTQ formatted output

LocalSoftware.Name: signalp
LocalSoftware.Description: signalp predicts the presence and location of signal peptide cleavage sites in amino acid sequences from different organisms: Gram-positive bacteria, Gram-negative bacteria, and eukaryotes.

LocalSoftware.Name: salmon
LocalSoftware.Description: Highly-accurate & wicked fast transcript-level quantification from RNA-seq reads using lightweight alignments.

LocalSoftware.Name: picard
LocalSoftware.Description: A set of Java command line tools for manipulating high-throughput sequencing data (HTS) data and formats.

LocalSoftware.Name: cutadapt
LocalSoftware.Description: Cutadapt removes adapter sequences from DNA high-throughput sequencing data.

LocalSoftware.Name: sickle
LocalSoftware.Description: A windowed adaptive trimming tool for FASTQ files using quality

LocalSoftware.Name: bamtools
LocalSoftware.Description: BamTools provides both a programmer's API and an end-user's toolkit for handling BAM files.

LocalSoftware.Description: cd-hit is a very widely used program for clustering and comparing protein or nucleotide sequences.

LocalSoftware.Name: tmhmm
LocalSoftware.Description: TMHMM 2.0 predicts transmembrane helices in proteins.

LocalSoftware.Name: bam-readcount
LocalSoftware.Description: The purpose of this program is to generate metrics at single nucleotide positions.

LocalSoftware.Name: trinotate
LocalSoftware.Description: Trinotate is a comprehensive annotation suite designed for automatic functional annotation of transcriptomes, particularly de novo assembled transcriptomes, from model or non-model organisms.

LocalSoftware.Name: trinotate
LocalSoftware.Description: Trinotate is a comprehensive annotation suite designed for automatic functional annotation of transcriptomes, particularly de novo assembled transcriptomes, from model or non-model organisms.

LocalSoftware.Name: transdecoder
LocalSoftware.Description: TransDecoder identifies candidate coding regions within transcript sequences, such as those generated by de novo RNA-Seq transcript assembly using Trinity, or constructed based on RNA-Seq alignments to the genome using Tophat and Cufflinks.

LocalSoftware.Name: interproscan
LocalSoftware.Description: Scans a range of protein signatures against your sequences and provides protein functional analysis.

LocalSoftware.Name: lmdb
LocalSoftware.Description: Lightning memory-mapped database library.

LocalSoftware.Name: pplacer
LocalSoftware.Description: Pplacer places query sequences on a fixed reference phylogenetic tree to maximize phylogenetic likelihood or posterior probability according to a reference alignment.

LocalSoftware.Name: caffe
LocalSoftware.Description: It is developed by the Berkeley Vision and Learning Center (BVLC) and by community contributors. Yangqing Jia created the project during his PhD at UC Berkeley. Caffe is released under the BSD 2-Clause license.

LocalSoftware.Description: Clearcut - The reference implementation for Relaxed Neighbor Joining (RNJ)

LocalSoftware.Name: prinseq-lite
LocalSoftware.Description: PRINSEQ can be used to filter, reformat, or trim your genomic and metagenomic sequence data.

LocalSoftware.Name: fastx_toolkit
LocalSoftware.Description: FASTX Toolkit is a collection of command line tools for Short-Reads FASTA/FASTQ files preprocessing.

LocalSoftware.Name: rmblast
LocalSoftware.Description: RMBlast is a RepeatMasker compatible version of the standard NCBI BLAST suite. The primary difference between this distribution and the NCBI distribution is the addition of a new program 'rmblastn' for use with RepeatMasker and RepeatModeler.

LocalSoftware.Name: prodigal
LocalSoftware.Description: Prodigal (Prokaryotic Dynamic Programming Genefinding Algorithm) is a microbial (bacterial and archaeal) gene finding program developed at Oak Ridge National Laboratory and the University of Tennessee.

LocalSoftware.Name: tabix
LocalSoftware.Description: Tabix indexes a TAB-delimited genome position file in.tab.bgz and creates an index file

LocalSoftware.Name: tophat
LocalSoftware.Description: TopHat2 is a fast splice junction mapper for RNA-Seq reads. It aligns RNA-Seq reads to mammalian-sized genomes using the ultra high-throughput short read aligner Bowtie, and then analyzes the mapping results to identify splice junctions between exons.

LocalSoftware.Name: tophat
LocalSoftware.Description: TopHat2 is a fast splice junction mapper for RNA-Seq reads. It aligns RNA-Seq reads to mammalian-sized genomes using the ultra high-throughput short read aligner Bowtie, and then analyzes the mapping results to identify splice junctions between exons.

LocalSoftware.Name: tassel
LocalSoftware.Description: While TASSEL has changed considerably since its initial public release in 2001, its primary function continues to be providing tools to investigate the relationship between phenotypes and genotypes1. As indicated by its title â€“ Trait Analysis by aSSociation, Evolution and Linkage â€“ TASSEL has multiple functions, including association study, evaluating evolutionary relationships, analysis of linkage disequilibrium, principal component analysis, cluster analysis, missing data imputation and data visualization.

LocalSoftware.Name: blat
LocalSoftware.Description: Blat is an alignment tool like BLAST, but it is structured differently. On DNA, Blat works by keeping an index of an entire genome in memory. Thus, the target database of BLAT is not a set of GenBank sequences, but instead an index derived from the assembly of the entire genome.
